results.title: David J. Chalmers, Strong and weak emergence
results.snippet: The term ‘emergence’ often causes_ _confusion in science and philosophy, as it is used to express at least_ _two quite different concepts. We can label these concepts _strong_ _emergence_ and _weak ...

results.title: Jessica Wilson, Metaphysical emergence: Weak and Strong
results.snippet: Each schema imposes a condition on the powers of entities taken to be emergent: Strong emergence requires that higher-level features have more token powers than their dependence base features, whereas Weak emergence requires that higher-level features have a proper subset of the token powers of their dependence base features.

results.title: D. M. Armstrong, Towards a Theory of Properties: Work in Progress on the Problem of Universals
results.snippet: Many philosophers have declared that everything which exists is a particular. There is a weak interpretation of this doctrine which I believe to be a true proposition, and a strong one which I believe to be false.
